channel.title: Runserver error
channel.description:
Hello-
I just got done fixing an error with the same message on my compiler and I was very happy. Then I went to try my run server and I got it again. This is the text that I put in when I try to edit the runserver.bat:
[cod3]@echo off title Runserver set java="C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\java.exe" java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pause[/cod3]
Now obviously there is something wrong here because this message comes up whenever I atually try to run the runserver.bat:
[cod3]'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .[/cod3]
If somebody would be nice enough to make any corrections to the code or to tell me what I'm doing wrong (or not doing at all), it would be greatly appreciated! Thanks!! :D [br][size=1]Posted on: March 03, 2007, 05:38:08 PM[/size][hr]Sorry for the "[cod3]" mistakes...

item.title: Runserver error
item.dc:creator: @Randomhero Randomhero
item.description:
@Randomhero wrote:

Well, at least I’m not the only one. LOL

BTW like I said before wherever I typed [cod3] or [/cod3], they were mistakes. Just ignore them.

item.title: Runserver error
item.dc:creator: @Randomhero Randomhero
item.description:
@Randomhero wrote:

Hello-

I just got done fixing an error with the same message on my compiler and I was very happy. Then I went to try my run server and I got it again. This is the text that I put in when I try to edit the runserver.bat:

[cod3]@echo off
title Runserver
set java=“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\java.exe”
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
pause[/cod3]

Now obviously there is something wrong here because this message comes up whenever I atually try to run the runserver.bat:

[cod3]‘java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
Press any key to continue . . .[/cod3]

If somebody would be nice enough to make any corrections to the code or to tell me what I’m doing wrong (or not doing at all), it would be greatly appreciated! Thanks!! [br][size=1]Posted on: March 03, 2007, 05:38:08 PM[/size][hr]Sorry for the “[cod3]” mistakes…

Read full topic
